title: Sampler Fragments, ca. 1650
medium:
Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk, linen
Technique: withdrawn element work with needle lace fillings
provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description: Three bands from a sampler. The bottom band is a scene which originally depicted Judith and her maid putting the newly severed head of Holofernes, Judith holds a sword in her left hand, the edge worked with red silk to indicate blood.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler Fragments, ca. 1650.
ca. 1650. Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk, linen
Technique: withdrawn element work with needle lace fillings. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-29.
